channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: I and I*-soft convergence in soft topological spaces
item.description: arXiv:2512.15291v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we introduce the notions of I and I*-soft convergence of sequences of soft points in soft topological spaces and study some basic properties of these notions. Also we introduce the notions of I-soft limit points and I-soft cluster points of a sequence of soft points in a soft topological space and study their interrelationship
item.dc:creator: Prasanta Malik, Anirban Paul

item.title: Simultaneous Sequential Compactness
item.description: arXiv:2512.15593v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: A set of sequences is said to converge simultaneously if there exists an infinite subset $H$ of the index set $\omega$ such that all sequences converge when restricted to $H$. We discuss simultaneous convergence of sequences in the same or in different sequentially compact spaces; we link the results for different spaces to ones for the same space; we show that simultaneous convergence happens for less than $\mathfrak s$ sequences in spaces with weight bounded by $\mathfrak s$ and for less than $\mathfrak h$ sequences in general; we show a slight generalisation of these results in the context of Hausdorff spaces; and finally we investigate their optimality.
item.dc:creator: Sirio Resteghini, Cesare Straffelini

item.title: Universally meager sets in the Miller model and similar ones
item.description: arXiv:2512.15490v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We work in the realm of sets of reals. We prove that in the Miller model and in a model constructed by Goldstern-Judah-Shelah all universally meager sets have size at most $\omega_1$. Some relations between combinatorial covering properties in these models allow to obtain the same limitations for sizes of Rothberger spaces and Hurewicz spaces with no homeomorphic copy of the Cantor set inside. It follows from our results that the existence of a strong measure zero set of size $\omega_2$ does not imply the existence of a Rothberger space of size $\omega_2$. We also prove that in the Miller model all strong measure zero sets have size at most $\omega_1$.
item.dc:creator: Valentin Haberl, Piotr Szewczak, Lyubomyr Zdomskyy

item.title: The Cantor Riemannium
item.description: arXiv:2004.10541v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The Riemann surface of a holomorphic germ is the space generated by its Weierstrass analytic continuation. The Riemannium space of a holomorphic germ is the space generated by its Borel monogenic continuation. Riemannium spaces are metric, path connected, Gromov length spaces, not necessarily $\sigma$-compact. We construct an example of Riemannium space: The Cantor Riemannium.
item.dc:creator: Ricardo P\'erez-Marco
